articles.title: Amazon stock breaks below 2020 low for the first time, heads for worst year since dot-com bust
articles.content: Amazon.com Inc. shares closed lower than their March 2020 nadir for the first time Thursday, as the tech giant's stock heads for its worst year since the dot-com bust.

articles.title: Apple Analyst Reduces FY23 Estimates Citing Macro, Supply Chain And Geo-Political Headwinds
articles.content:
Needham analyst Laura Martin reiterated Buy on Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL) with a $170 price target.
Martin reduced FY23 estimates for AAPL. The analyst now projects just 2% revenue growth and lower EPS Y/Y in FY23. 
However, Martin believes these weak core fundamentals will accelerate the development of a CTV ad revenue stream for AAPL's OTT streaming service called Apple+.
The analyst saw Apple+ set to gain from mobile advertising globally at $400 billion a year, and total digital advertising is $650 billion a year. Advertising typically has 70%+ gross profit margins.
Additionally, AAPL is putting high-quality content on its OTT service that no one is watching because its monthly price is too high. Adding an ad-driven tier is an easy way to ...Full story available on Benzinga.com

articles.title: This Historical Trend Debunks Predictions For Weak First Half Of 2023: Analyst
articles.content:
The financial markets were in the doldrums for 2022, with every asset class experiencing sell-offs amid the macro challenges.
One analyst, however, expects better times ahead.
What Happened:  Everyone expects the first half of 2023 to be bad for stocks, Carson Group's chief market strategist Ryan Detrick says, referring to all of the recession predictions in recent months.
See also: Best Penny Stocks
The economy has yet to reflect the lagging impact of the Federal Reserve’s successive rate hikes. To make matters worse, geopolitical risks continue to weigh down on the global economy.
Detrick, however, noted that the first quarter in a pre-election year was lower only once since 1950. That means, in 17 of the 18 instances, the ...Full story available on Benzinga.com

articles.title: Alphabet (GOOGL) Boosts YouTube Streaming Efforts With NFL Deal
articles.content: Alphabet's (GOOGL) Google is in talks with the National Football League to get exclusive NFL Sunday ticket rights for streaming Sunday matches on YouTube TV and Primetime Channels.

articles.title: Netflix (NFLX) Grows International Portfolio With Danish Shows
articles.content: Netflix (NFLX) is set to launch a couple of Danish shows that will strengthen its foreign language content portfolio.

articles.title: iPhone 14 Was No Match For This Smartphone In Marques Brownlee's Blind Camera Test
articles.content:
Alphabet Inc.'s (NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) Google Pixel 6a has topped the charts of the "Best Overall" device in a blind camera test defeating Google Pixel 7 Pro and Apple Inc.'s (NASDAQ: AAPL) iPhone 14 Pro — which slipped to the seventh place on the list.
What Happened: YouTuber Marques Brownlee's blind camera test might not be entirely scientific, but it garnered more than 21 million votes, an impressive number.
